Did__hex.title: Data Identifier (DID)
Did__hex.description: Unique hexadecimal identifier for the diagnostic parameter. Must be in format 0xXXXX. This identifier is used by diagnostic tools to request specific data from the ECU.

Conv_Rule.title: Conversion Rule
Conv_Rule.description: Defines how the raw data should be interpreted and converted for display. ASCII for text data, VALUE for numeric data with scaling, ENUM for predefined value mappings.

size_Bytes.title: Data Size
size_Bytes.description: Size of the parameter data in bytes. Determines how much data to read from the ECU. Common sizes are 1, 2, 4, or 8 bytes.

Desc.title: Parameter Description
Desc.description: Human-readable description of what this parameter represents. Should be descriptive enough for technicians to understand the parameter's purpose.

Unit.title: Measurement Unit
Unit.description: The unit of measurement for this parameter (e.g., V for volts, mA for milliamps, Celsius for temperature, RPM for rotational speed). Use 'NONE' if the parameter has no unit.

scaling.title: Scaling Factor
scaling.description: Multiplier applied to raw values to get the actual measurement. For example, 0.001 converts millivolts to volts. Use 'NONE' for no scaling (ASCII/ENUM types).

Offset.title: Offset Value
Offset.description: Value added to the scaled result. Used for parameters that don't start at zero or need baseline adjustment. Use 'NONE' for no offset.

Enum_List.title: Enumeration List
Enum_List.description: Comma-separated list of value mappings for ENUM type parameters. Format: 'value=description,value=description'. Use 'NONE' for non-enum parameters.

AccessPvg.title: Access Privilege
AccessPvg.description: Defines whether the parameter can be read only or both read and written. READ-only parameters are for monitoring, READ/WRITE parameters can be configured.

Group_ID.title: Parameter Group
Group_ID.description: Logical grouping of related parameters for organization and access control. GROUP_A typically contains identification data, GROUP_B contains operational data.

MemAddrBytes.title: Memory Address Bytes
MemAddrBytes.description: Number of bytes used for memory addressing in diagnostic operations. Typically 0 for standard operations, higher values for advanced memory operations.

EraseRoutineID.title: Erase Routine ID
EraseRoutineID.description: Identifier for the memory erase routine used during ECU reprogramming. 0x0000 indicates no erase routine or default routine.

ChecksumRoutineID.title: Checksum Routine ID
ChecksumRoutineID.description: Identifier for the checksum verification routine used during reprogramming to ensure data integrity. 0x0000 indicates default routine.

XtendedSecurityAlgotype.title: Extended Security Algorithm Type
XtendedSecurityAlgotype.description: Type of security algorithm used for authentication and encryption during diagnostic sessions. Different values represent different security levels and algorithms.

XtendedSecurityL3Const.title: Extended Security Level 3 Constant
XtendedSecurityL3Const.description: Security constant used for Level 3 authentication. This is a cryptographic seed value used in security access algorithms.

XtendedSecurityL5Const.title: Extended Security Level 5 Constant
XtendedSecurityL5Const.description: Security constant used for Level 5 authentication. Higher security level constant for advanced diagnostic operations.

hexFileNameDID.title: Hex File Name DID
hexFileNameDID.description: Data Identifier for retrieving the hex filename used during programming. Useful for tracking software versions and programming history.

swPartNoDID.title: Software Part Number DID
swPartNoDID.description: Data Identifier for retrieving the software part number. Used for version control and compatibility verification.

isBalNetEncrypted.title: BalNet Encryption Status
isBalNetEncrypted.description: Indicates whether BalNet communication is encrypted. True enables encryption for secure communication between diagnostic tools and ECU.

isUDSEncrypted.title: UDS Encryption Status
isUDSEncrypted.description: Indicates whether UDS (Unified Diagnostic Services) communication is encrypted. Affects diagnostic session security.

balnetFingerPrintAddress.title: BalNet Fingerprint Address
balnetFingerPrintAddress.description: Memory address where the BalNet fingerprint is stored. Used for authentication and security verification.

balnetProgConstant.title: BalNet Programming Constant
balnetProgConstant.description: Constant value used in BalNet programming algorithms. Part of the cryptographic protocol for secure programming.

balnetFingerPrintSizeInHexFile.title: BalNet Fingerprint Size
balnetFingerPrintSizeInHexFile.description: Size of the BalNet fingerprint data in the hex file, specified in bytes. Used for fingerprint validation.

balnetVinAddress.title: BalNet VIN Address
balnetVinAddress.description: Memory address where the Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) is stored in BalNet protocol.

isBalnetCheckSumPresent.title: BalNet Checksum Present
isBalnetCheckSumPresent.description: Indicates whether checksum verification is enabled for BalNet operations. True enables additional data integrity checking.

timerToWait.title: Timer to Wait
timerToWait.description: Timeout value in milliseconds for diagnostic operations. Defines how long to wait for ECU responses before timing out.

isBalFailLog.title: BalNet Failure Logging
isBalFailLog.description: Enables logging of BalNet communication failures. Useful for debugging communication issues and tracking error patterns.

isAppLog.title: Application Logging
isAppLog.description: Enables application-level logging for diagnostic operations. Provides detailed logs of diagnostic session activities.

maskDtc.title: DTC Mask
maskDtc.description: Mask value for Diagnostic Trouble Code (DTC) operations. Used to filter which DTCs are processed during diagnostic sessions.

maxTimeFlashReq.title: Maximum Flash Request Time
maxTimeFlashReq.description: Maximum time in seconds allowed for flash programming requests. Prevents excessive wait times during ECU programming.

timerToWaitForFlashing.title: Flash Programming Wait Timer
timerToWaitForFlashing.description: Timeout value in milliseconds specifically for flash programming operations. Usually longer than standard diagnostic timeouts.

isDTC.title: DTC Operations Enabled
isDTC.description: Enables Diagnostic Trouble Code (DTC) read/clear operations. When true, allows access to stored fault codes in the ECU.

isDID.title: DID Operations Enabled
isDID.description: Enables Data Identifier (DID) read operations. When true, allows reading of diagnostic data identifiers from the ECU.

isWriteDID.title: DID Write Operations Enabled
isWriteDID.description: Enables Data Identifier (DID) write operations. When true, allows writing/configuring diagnostic parameters in the ECU.

isReprograming.title: Reprogramming Enabled
isReprograming.description: Enables ECU reprogramming functionality. When true, allows flashing new software to the ECU.

isAnalyticsGraph.title: Analytics Graph Enabled
isAnalyticsGraph.description: Enables analytics and graphing functionality for diagnostic data. When true, allows real-time data visualization.

isActuatorRoutines.title: Actuator Routines Enabled
isActuatorRoutines.description: Enables actuator test routines. When true, allows activation of ECU outputs for testing purposes (motors, solenoids, etc.).

isBootReprograming.title: Boot Reprogramming Enabled
isBootReprograming.description: Enables bootloader reprogramming functionality. When true, allows updating the ECU's bootloader software.

isSpecialOperation.title: Special Operations Enabled
isSpecialOperation.description: Enables special diagnostic operations beyond standard UDS services. When true, allows access to manufacturer-specific functions.

shouldWriteMotorType.title: Motor Type Writing Enabled
shouldWriteMotorType.description: Enables writing motor type identification parameters. When true, allows configuration of motor type settings in the ECU.

bmsWattVendorCode.title: BMS Watt Vendor Code
bmsWattVendorCode.description: Three-character vendor code for BMS Watt identification. Must be exactly 3 characters in length.
